intro: Seseli tortuosum proles ramosissimum, commonly known as the branching seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
